conbody.p: This section describes the elements of the SM GUI.

section.title: Log in and log out of the SM GUI
section.p: To log into the SM GUI, open the web browser and enter https://<virtual IP address of IOHO>/servicemanager in the address bar. Then enter the username and password to access the SM GUI.

note.p: The credentials to access the SM GUI are shared over email when a new user is created.

section.title: Launch pad
section.p: Once a user logs into the SM GUI, the Launch Pad is displayed that provides various options. You can select the desired category under which all the entities belonging to that particular category are available.

table.title: Categories available on the SM GUI

entry.p: Allows you to provision the entities related to charging and policy such as charging services, rates, lifecycles, thresholds, rule system versions and those items that are common to both charging and policy.
The Policy and Charging application data is available in the Policy User Guide and the Charging User Guide respectively.
Allows you to provision the entities related to the subscriber model such as device, user, group, account, custom data, sessions, and message tracing.
The Subscriber Manager application data is available in the Subscriber Manager Guide.
Allows you to provision the entities related to the notification service such as server configurations, notification profiles and notification templates.
The Notification Configuration application data is available in the Notification Service (NS) Userâ€™s Guide.
Allows you to provision the entities related to Diameter such as peers, routes, throttling profile, overload and message manipulation.
The Diameter Configuration application data is available in the Diameter Configuration Guide.
Allows you to provision the service manager settings such as a managed element list, operator and role administration, and application preferences.
The Global Configuration application is available in the Global Configuration Guide.
